review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021
name: Twinkletoes
title: No sugar, please
review: This tastes alright and has good texture and consistency. I would love to find a plain coconut yogurt just like this, but without any added sweetener.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021
name: abbc
title: Light and Refreshing Taste - Low Sugar and Low Saturated Fat
review: I've been searching for the best alternative to regular yogurts, and this is the best found I found. The flavor is super fresh and light. It is also one of the best alternatives for a low calorie, very low saturated fat and lower sugar - if compared to other vegan/non dairy option.Will keep buying it!

title: Average
review: Love that this brand has started making a yogurt alternative, but this yogurt is just too sweet for me. Still looking for a good option with less sugar.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2021
name: Sergio T
title: Too many sugar inside
review: The size is perfect.However, because of this yogurt has sugar, I prefer the liquid unsweetened version of it.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
name: Inky Digits
title: Good starter; too mild to enjoy on its own
review: This has a very mild flavor; I wouldn't recommend eating it if you're looking for a tart yogurt flavor.It is a pretty good starter though. I mixed it with a can of full fat coconut milk and let it ferment for 3 days (covered with a napkin, whisked periodically). That new batch of yogurt is much better, and now I can use that for starter (and probably only have to wait 2 days for a new ferment).I would rate this 3 stars as a yogurt, but 4, maybe even 5 stars, as a starter.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
title: SO GOOD, but I can't eat it ;/
review: This yogurt is beyond delicious.I'm really over the moon about it.However, it somehow gives me a similar reaction to what happens when I have cow's milk/cream (!?!?).I have NO idea why, and other plant-based yogurts don't do it.In fact, I don't think the Harmless Harvest drinkable yogurt does it, but I still have to confirm that.It's VERY upsetting that I have to give up my favorite yogurt right after finding it, but I'm sure most other people can eat it just fine.The plain is so good it's my favorite.The flavors are okay/fine.But the vanilla one is TERRIBLE, as far as I'm concerned.And I usually like vanilla yogurt.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
name: Amy W.
title: Great lactose free alternative
review: Great flavor and natural sweetness.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2021
name: Avid Reader
title: Won't buy again
review: I bought two, didn't finish the first one and threw away the second. Not good at all. Tastes like paste.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2021
name: Nathalie Mitchell
title: Mold in yogurt
review: I love this yogurt unfortunately I had way too many issues with mold and will no longer be purchasing the yogurts. It seems to be a constant issue with this company. I contacted the company probably 4 to 5 times in less then a year. You would think they would have fixed the issue by now. Just so disappointed because they taste really good but it has become a hassle to store the moldy yogurt until the next time I can get to the store for a refund.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2021
name: Sid
title: Tastes like their waters and thin consistency
review: If you love the taste of their coconut waters, you will probably like this yogurt. It's not too sweet and has the consistency of nonfat cows milk yogurt. However, I prefer the thick, creamy coconut yogurts from other brands.
